name: B. Who's Opposite
statement:
Some number of people (this number is even) have stood in a circle. The
people stand in the circle evenly. They are numbered clockwise starting
from a person with the number 1. Each person is looking through the
circle’s center at the opposite person. You don’t know the exact number
of people standing in the circle (but this number is even, no doubt). It
is known that the person with the number a is looking at the person with
the number b (and vice versa, of course). What is the number associated
with a person being looked at by the person with the number c? If, for
the specified a, b, and c, no such circle exists, output .
